poem:
Title: "Reflections on a Divided Isle"

Two flags – one emerald green, one red and blue,
Union Jack flaps sternly, 'neath an Irish dew.
Maps drawn in blood, beliefs in rigid ink,
A house where brother refuses brother's drink.
Imagine tracing roots with gentle thought,
Careful as a gardener tending a plot.
Both can be, in answer to the question,
An Irish lark in a British ascension.
